intro: Galium exaltatum, commonly known as tall whitebed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Galium exaltatum is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
